text: Lapu-Lapu's at-large congressional district is the congressional district of the Philippines in Lapu-Lapu. It has been represented in the House of Representatives of the Philippines since 2010. Previously included in Cebu's 6th congressional district, it includes all barangays of the city. It is currently represented in the 18th Congress by Paz Radaza of the Lakas–CMD. == Representation history == {| class="wikitable" ! rowspan="2" |# ! colspan="2" rowspan="2" |Member ! colspan="2" |Term of office ! rowspan="2" |Congress ! rowspan="2" |Party ! rowspan="2" |Electoral history ! rowspan="2" width="33%" |Constituent LGUs |- !Start !End |- | colspan="9" style="text-align:center;" |District created October 22, 2009, redistricted from Cebu's 6th district. |- | 1 | style="background:;" | | Arthur Radaza | June 30, 2010 | June 30, 213 |15th | Lakas |Elected in 2010. | rowspan="4" align="center" |2010–present: Lapu-Lapu |- |rowspan="2"| 2 |style="background:;" | |rowspan="2"| Aileen Radaza |rowspan="2"| June 30, 2013 |rowspan="2"| June 30, 2019 |16th | Lakas |Elected in 2013. |- | style="background:;" | |17th | PDP–Laban |Re-elected in 2016. |- | 3 | style="background:;" | | Paz Radaza | June 30, 2019 | Present |18th | Lakas |Elected in 2019. |} == Election results == === 2010 === ===2013=== ===2016=== ===2019=== ==See also== *Legislative district of Lapu- Lapu ==References== Category:Congressional districts of the Philippines Category:Politics of Lapu-Lapu, Philippines Category:2009 establishments in the Philippines
title: Lapu-Lapu's at-large congressional district
